summary: This document is an internal inmate communication from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 14, 2019. It contains a forwarded message thread between an inmate (Favela, Feliciano IV) and a prison psychiatrist regarding medication non-compliance. The inmate's messages include hostile accusations and a specific hope that the psychiatrist is involved in the 'negligence of Epstein' and gets fired.

persons.name: Favela, Feliciano IV
persons.context: An inmate at MCC New York who is communicating with a prison psychiatrist about medication side effects and non-compliance. His messages contain angry accusations and a reference to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Dr. B
persons.context: A psychiatrist following the inmate's case at MCC New York, referenced by another staff member in a message about the inmate's medication compliance.

connections.description: Inmate Favela is under the psychiatric care of Dr. B at MCC New York, but is non-compliant with medication and disputes its efficacy.

events.title: Inmate medication dispute
events.description: Inmate Favela, Feliciano IV sends an angry message to a prison psychiatrist complaining that prescribed medication is ineffective and causes side effects, and accuses the staff of negligence.

events.title: Message forwarded regarding Epstein negligence
events.description: An internal message is forwarded within MCC New York containing the inmate's prior complaint, which includes a hope that the psychiatrist is 'involved with epsteins neglect' and gets fired.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: Federal detention facility where the inmate is held and where this internal communication originates.

keyFacts: The document is an internal inmate communication from MCC New York dated August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Inmate Favela, Feliciano IV references 'epsteins neglect' in a hostile message to prison psychiatric staff, indicating inmate awareness and commentary on the Epstein case within the facility.
The communication shows standard prison procedures for inmate-staff messaging and medication management disputes.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) document set related to the Epstein case.
